messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] coffee drinking kids
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/22/2005 8:40:44 A.M. Mountain Standard Time, starsuncloud@comcast.net writes: I m  famous for my Chai made from scratch, it s a lovely
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/22/2005 8:40:44 A.M. Mountain Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:


I'm famous for my Chai made from scratch, it's a lovely drink and makes the
entire house smell of spices.



Ren...can you share your recipe? I'm freezing here in Albuquerque after all
those years in Florida!

Gail

messages.subject: coffee drinking kids
messages.msgSnippet: We don t usually have coffee on a regular basis, especially since my french press broke. But Trevor (15, almost 16) would ask me to make it about once a week
messages.messageBody:
We don't usually have coffee on a regular basis, especially since my french press broke. But Trevor (15, almost 16) would ask me to make it about once a week from fair trade beans.
Sierra (8) also asks me to make it occasionally and all of them will ask for it if we're out at the book store or Charbucks.:)
When I attended Unity in Pensacola, Sierra was the only kid that liked coming with me (she said it was all for the "Let there be Peace on Earth" song) and always had a cup or two of coffee after the service.
So she was a once-a-week drinker then. I'm a major tea drinker, occasional coffee drinker, as is dh.

I'm famous for my Chai made from scratch, it's a lovely drink and makes the entire house smell of spices.

Ren

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
